summary: This document describes patterns of sexual exploitation by Jeffrey Epstein, including his methods of grooming victims through massages, escalating to sexual assault, and pressuring them to recruit friends. It notes Epstein was never charged for activities after 2008 and references his 2019 arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as offering massages to women, then pressuring them into sex acts, sexually assaulting them, and joking about their discomfort. He pressured them to bring female friends.

connections.description: Groff served as Epstein's executive assistant, responsible for circulating his daily schedules.

events.title: Epstein's arrest and indictment
events.description: Epstein was arrested and indicted, with the focus on alleged abuse (text partially redacted/garbled).

keyFacts: Epstein used a pattern of offering massages to women to relax them, then escalated to masturbation, pressuring them into sex acts, sometimes using sex toys and involving other women.
Some women stated Epstein sexually assaulted them, after which he often joked about their discomfort and gave them tips to improve sexually for next time.
Epstein pressured victims to bring their female friends to him.
Lesley Groff, Epstein's executive assistant, circulated his daily schedules.
Epstein was never charged with a crime for his activities after 2008, but was arrested and indicted in 2019.
